instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi 
I have 820-165 with water damaged there is 2 resistors 1k ohm missed from board  ( <RESISTOR>R5283</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5296</RESISTOR>)  these  voltage <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> , <SIGNAL>SMC_TOPBLK_SWP_L</SIGNAL> , <SIGNAL>PCH_STRP_TOPBLK_SWP_L</SIGNAL> on the 2 resistors.
is it reason for the computer too slow in installation system    thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did you solder new resistors there?

Did PRAM reset?
USB preinstalled macOS works slow?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
no i didnot solder but it cant start normally
just start after reset
and it take 6 hours to install system
